_header: Blessed lady O princess of mercy
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Fifteen Joys of Our Lady’ — twenty-eight stanzas rhyme royal

BodLatLitE47.First Lines:
O blyssyd lady o princesse of mercyModyr callyd of grace and of
                    pety…
BodLatLitE47.Last Lines:
…Þer may be made non comparisonffor thilk ioy of ioys
                    soueraygnest…
BodLatLitE47.Note:
Leaves misbound; order should be 211, 203, 212, 216, 215, 214, 213, 218,
                    217; 25 stanzas plus 4 lines of 26th, on the fifteenth joy; ends
                    incomplete.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
O blessyd Lady o princes of mercyModyr callyd of grace and of
                    pyteWelle of goodnes that sprang most souerenlyClere as crystall in
                    thy virginite…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…To loue the best in to my lyfys endeAnd ioy euerlastyng when
                    I shall hens wende
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: John Lydgate (added by later hand, ff. 170, 172v)
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
The xv ioyes of our lady secundum lydgate (added by later hand, f.
                    170)

BLCottTitAXXVI.First Lines:
Blessed lady O pryncesse of mercyModer ecallyd of grace and of
                    pyte…
BLCottTitAXXVI.Last Lines:
…The forto sewe vnto my lyvys endeAnd my sovle saue whanne I
                    schale hens wende
BLCottTitAXXVI.Attributed Author: by daun Iohn the monke of Bury (f. 157v)
BLCottTitAXXVI.Attributed Title:
To my lordes and ladyes here Begynnen ȝe fyfftene Ioyes of oure lady
                    cleped ȝe XV Ioes (f. 157v); ȝe fifftene Ioyes of oure
                    ladye (RT)
BLCottTitAXXVI.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 260-7.

TokyoTak4.First Lines:
Blessed lady princesse of mercyModir callild of grace and
                    pyte…
TokyoTak4.Last Lines:
…To loue the best vnto my lyfes endeAnd Ioy euerlastynge whan
                    I shal hens wende
TokyoTak4.Note:
Third text after Speculum (MS unfoliated; second text after table
                    of chapters of Speculum Viate).

TokyoTak17.First Lines:
Blessid Lady O princesse of mercyModir called of grace and of
                    Pite…
TokyoTak17.Last Lines:
…To love the beste in to my lyvis endeAnd Ioye euer lasting
                    whan y shall hense wende
TokyoTak17.Note:
Between each stanza a scroll with refrain, ‘Aue
                    Maria’.
